error.signature: CUDA error: no kernel image is available for execution on the device
error.regex: no kernel image is available for execution on the device

verdict.summary: The compiled CUDA binary doesn't include kernels for the GPU architecture (compute capability mismatch).

dead_ends.action: Installing a different CUDA toolkit version
dead_ends.why_fails: The toolkit version doesn't determine compiled architectures

dead_ends.action: Using CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES to select a different GPU
dead_ends.why_fails: All GPUs on the machine likely have the same architecture

workarounds.action: Rebuild with the correct CUDA architecture: set TORCH_CUDA_ARCH_LIST or pass -arch=sm_XX
workarounds.how: For RTX 3090 use sm_86, RTX 4090 use sm_89, A100 use sm_80

workarounds.action: Install pre-built binaries that support your GPU: pip install torch --index-url https://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu121
workarounds.how: PyTorch wheels include all common architectures

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'CUDA error' indicates an invalid next/image src prop, while 'RuntimeError' indicates a cuBLAS library initialization failure.
'CUDA error' indicates an invalid next/image src prop, while 'NVIDIA-SMI has failed because it couldn't communicate with the NVIDIA driver' indicates NVIDIA driver communication failure.
